data.name: It gets more oily than necessary and results in more pimples, blackheads and clogged pores. Light, hydrating and non-comedogenic products without a lot of oils are suitable. Also AHA/BHA peeling acids 1-2 times a week. However, they can irritate the skin and it is important to follow them with good hydration to protect the skin barrier.
data.value: It gets more oily than necessary and results in more pimples, blackheads and clogged pores. Light, hydrating and non-comedogenic products without a lot of oils are suitable. Also AHA/BHA peeling acids 1-2 times a week. However, they can irritate the skin and it is important to follow them with good hydration to protect the skin barrier.

data.name: It's easy! Cleanse your face with a gentle
data.value:
It's easy! Cleanse your face with a gentle, rinse-off cleanser without AHAs or other exfoliants. Rinse, gently dry and do not apply any other products. After about 30 minutes and check how the skin feels:

- if it tightens, pulls or flakes or just feels... dry

- if it got greasy... it's greasy

- and if it's greasy in places, e.g. nose and forehead, and it's drier elsewhere, you have combination skin, which is also the most common skin type

data.name: NOTE: These routines are examples only. Use them and adapt them according to your needs. The information on this page and on the site is for educational purposes only. For diagnosis, prevention, or treatment of medical conditions, consult a physician.
data.value: NOTE: These routines are examples only. Use them and adapt them according to your needs. The information on this page and on the site is for educational purposes only. For diagnosis, prevention, or treatment of medical conditions, consult a physician.

data.name: On the T-zone you can have a routine for oily... and on the cheeks a routine... But who wants a routine for every part of the face?! Try different products and experiment. Do not use every product on the whole face, but more or more often where it is needed. For example, AHA peeling on the T-zone and less often on the whole face. And lotion mainly mainly on the cheeks. Listen to your skin and its needs.
data.value: On the T-zone you can have a routine for oily... and on the cheeks a routine... But who wants a routine for every part of the face?! Try different products and experiment. Do not use every product on the whole face, but more or more often where it is needed. For example, AHA peeling on the T-zone and less often on the whole face. And lotion mainly mainly on the cheeks. Listen to your skin and its needs.

data.name:
To choose suitable products. There is no point in expensive cosmetics if they are not suitable for you. Skin types are dry, oily and combination, and in addition it can be sensitive. Different products are designed to help with different skin problems. Products for oily skin would exhaust dry skin and vice versa. The right products are the basis of a good routine.

Did you know that skin type can change? The skin grows and regenerates constantly. It adapts and changes. After prolonged use of products, the skin type may change.
